roleset.name: injure very badly, disable

example.name: passive, no agent
example.text: But [a Soviet bank]-1 here would be crippled *trace*-1 unless Moscow found a way to settle the $188 million debt, which was lent to the country's short-lived democratic Kerensky government before the Communists seized power in 1917.
example.arg: unless Moscow found a way to settle the $188 million debt, which was lent to the country's short-lived democratic Kerensky government before the Communists seized power in 1917.

example.name: passive with agent
example.text: Founded as the Examiner in 1903 by Mr. Hearst, [the Herald]-1 was crippled *trace*-1 by a bitter, decade-long strike that began in 1967 and cut circulation in half.
example.arg: Founded as the Examiner in 1903 by Mr. Hearst,
by a bitter, decade-long strike that began in 1967 and cut circulation in half.

example.name: active
example.text: An 11-week dispute involving Australia's 1,640 domestic pilots has slashed airline earnings and crippled much of the continent's tourist industry.
example.arg: An 11-week dispute involving Australia's 1,640 domestic pilots
much of the continent's tourist industry.

example.name: ARG2 and ARG1
example.text: Elsewhere in the Middle East , officials from the FBI and the CIA and marine anti-terrorist specialists have arrived in Yemen to investigate yesterday 's explosion that crippled the US Navy destroyer , Cole .

roleset.note: CRIPPLE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'cripple' based on sentences in wsj. No Verbnet entry at the moment. (from cripple.01-v predicate notes)
